js:knimeNode.name: Histogram (JavaScript)
js:knimeNode.shortDescription: A histogram based on the NVD3 library.

intro.n:p: A histogram based on the NVD3 library.

The node supports custom CSS styling. You can simply put CSS rules into a single string and set it as a flow variable 'customCSS' in the node configuration dialog. You will find the list of available classes and their description on our documentation page.

options.columnSelectorOption: Select the column that contains the values used to calculate the bins for the histogram.
options.radioButtonOption: Select the aggregation method used on the selected frequency columns. In case of Occurrence Count the occurrence of the unique values of the selected category columns are determined.
options.columnFilterOption:
Select the columns with frequencies for which you wish to plot bars. Note: Missing values in the frequency column will be ignored with a corresponding warning message.
If, after aggregation, some bars or entire categories contain only missing values, they will be excluded from the view and a warning message will be raised.
options.checkBoxOption: Process the table in the memory. Requires more memory but is faster since the table needs not to be sorted prior aggregation. The memory consumption depends on the number of unique groups and the chosen aggregation method.

Check to get the detailed warning messages in the view about missing values and enable 'Missing values' category.
If not checked, missing values will be ignored without raising a warning. 'Missing values' category will not be present.
If checked, missing values in the category column will form a separate class named "Missing values". Otherwise they will be ignored.

radioButtonOption.name: Binning method
radioButtonOption.label: Binning method
radioButtonOption.possibleValues: Fixed number of bins Sample quantiles

options.radioButtonOption:
Use Fixed number of bins for bins with equal width over the domain range or bins that have an equal frequency of element occurrences.
Use Sample quantiles to produces bins corresponding to the given list of probabilities. The smallest element corresponds to a probability of 0 and the largest to probability of 1. The applied estimation method is Type 7 which is the default method in R, S and Excel.
options.integerOption: Number of bins for the fixed number binning method.
options.stringListOption: Choose bins of equal width or equal frequency for the fixed number binning method.
options.stringOption: Provide a comma separated list of quantiles for the sample quantiles binning method.
options.radioButtonOption: Use Numbered for bins labeled by an integer with prefix "Bin", Borders for labels using '"(a,b]"' interval notation or Midpoints for labels that show the midpoint of the interval.

checkBoxOption.name: Force integer bounds
checkBoxOption.label: Force integer bounds
checkBoxOption.n:p: Forces the bounds of the interval to be integers. The decimal bounds will be converted so that the lower bound of the first interval will be the floor of the lowest value and the upper bound of the last interval will be the ceiling of the highest value. The edges that separate the intervals will be the ceiling of the decimal edges. Duplicates of edges will be removed.

options.radioButtonOption: If advanced formatting is enabled the format of the doubles in the labels can be configured by the options in this tab.

stringListOption.name: Output format
stringListOption.label: Output format
stringListOption.possibleValues: Standard String Plain String (no exponent) Engineering String

options.stringListOption:
Specify the output format.
The number 0.00000035239 will be displayed as 3.52E-7 with Standard String, 0.000000352 with Plain String (no exponent) and 352E-9 with Engineering String.
options.integerOption: The scale of the double values to round to. If the scale is reduced the specified rounding mode is applied.
options.stringListOption: The type of precision to which the values are rounded. Decimal places, the default option rounds to the specified decimal places, whereas significant figures rounds to significant figures or numbers.

stringListOption.name: Rounding mode
stringListOption.label: Rounding mode
stringListOption.possibleValues: UP DOWN CEILING FLOOR HALF_UP HALF_DOWN HALF_EVEN

options.stringListOption:
The rounding mode which is applied when double values are rounded.
The rounding mode specifies the rounding behavior. Seven different rounding modes are available:
UP: Rounding mode to round away from zero.
DOWN: Rounding mode to round towards zero.
CEILING: Rounding mode to round towards positive infinity.
FLOOR: Rounding mode to round towards negative infinity.
HALF_UP: Rounding mode to round towards "nearest neighbor" unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case round up.
HALF_DOWN: Rounding mode to round towards "nearest neighbor" unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case round down.
HALF_EVEN: Rounding mode to round towards the "nearest neighbor" unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case, round towards the even neighbor.
For a detailed description of each rounding mode please see the
Java documentation.

options.stringOption: The label used for the category axis.
The label used for the frequency axis.
options.radioButtonOption: Select how to display the histogram columns. In Grouped chart one bar indicates a separate value from a column, while in Stacked chart a bar is a stack of all values in a column.
options.checkBoxOption: When checked, the histogram legend is displayed.
When checked, a rich tooltip is displayed when hovering over the individual bars of the histogram.
Check to plot the histogram horizontally. By default the histogram is plotted with vertical bars.
Check to display a button which switches the view into fullscreen mode. The button is only available in the KNIME WebPortal.
Check if the maximum of the Y-Axis should be displayed.
If checked, warning messages will be displayed in the view when they occur.
Check to enable controls in the chart.
Check to enable the display a control to choose grouped or stacked display of the bars.
Check to enable interactive toggling between a horizontal or vertical histogram.
Check to enable the editing of the title within the view.
Check to enable the editing of the subtitle within the view.
Check to enable the editing of the axis titles within the view.
Check to enable to show and hide 'Missing values' category in the view.

checkBoxOption.name: Enable showing maximum value on y-axis
checkBoxOption.label: Enable showing maximum value on y-axis

options.checkBoxOption: Check to enable to show and hide maximum value on the y-axis.

tab.name: Interactivity
tab.description: The JavaScript histogram view allows for several ways of interactivity. Please use the options below to configure which features will be activated on the view and further configuration of interactive properties.

options.checkBoxOption: If checked a separate column containing checkboxes is rendered in the view.
If checked, the view reacts on notifications from other interactive views that the selection has been changed. See also "Publish selection events".
If checked, notifies other interactive views when user changes the selection in the current view. See also "Subscribe to selection events".
Displays a button to clear current selection.
